question: ‘World Economic Outlook (WEO)’ is the flagship report of which international institution, that recently lowered India’s growth to 1.9 % in 2020-21?
explanation:
The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has released the latest version of its flagship report ‘World Economic Outlook (WEO)’. 
In the report, it has lowered India’s Gross Domestic Product growth rate to 1.9 per cent in the fiscal year 2020-21 amid the prevailing lock-down. However, the global agency expects the GDP growth rate of India to rise to 7.4 per cent in the next fiscal year 2021-22.
